definition: to await death/to be a sitting duck
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to die/to shoot dead/to reject/to fall forward/(suffix) to death
to sit and wait for death (idiom); resigned to one's fate
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction

sentences.english: But that doesn’t mean Guangdong Province is sitting idle.
sentences.chinese: 不過，這並不意味着廣東省正在坐以待斃。

sentences.english: Country full of open-minded hatred of hate at home, Wu may not want to sit still.
sentences.chinese: 國恨家仇滿襟懷，伍子胥可不願坐以待斃。

sentences.english: Tom would not await his doom.
We can do nothing and get swamped, or learn to surf and ride the wave.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以束手待斃，或者學會衝浪，駕馭浪潮。

sentences.english: Then my last illness seized me, and I returned hither to die.
sentences.chinese: 後來，致命的疾病纏住了我，我回到這裏已奄奄待斃。

sentences.english: We are sitting ducks in a celestial shooting gallery, an asteroid might strike at any time.
sentences.chinese: 我們正坐以待斃，一顆小遊星會隨時隨地撞擊地球。

sentences.english: Moneyed elites are no slouches when it comes to defending their interests.
sentences.chinese: 有錢的精英們在捍衛他們的利益時決不會坐以待斃。
